list_definition.definition: to be aware of or to have been informed about

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I know he is at home because his car is in the drive
I know of no reason why you cannot go.

list_definition.definition: to have learned and to remember

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He knows a lot of poetry.

list_definition.definition: to be aware of the identity of; to be friendly with

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I know Mrs Taylor – she lives near me.

list_definition.definition: to (be able to) recognize or identify

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You would hardly know her now – she has become very thin
He knows a good car when he sees one.

list_ex_of_english: This much, at least, is what every student of music is required to know.
These are bindings made before it is known that a solution exists.
But there are also unknown unknowns-the ones we don't know we don't know.
We do this because we do not know what else to do.
We do not know what that may imply in the future.
The players do not need to know anything about each other except the actual strategies chosen in each round.
But, it says, we do not know which ones (or to what extent).
To acquaint oneself is to find out, and to be acquainted with something is to know it.
